Annotation.note:
A theorem about Napoleon triangles: Let $\Delta\,ABC$ be an arbitrary triangle and $P,Q$ and $R$ the third vertex of equilateral triangles erected externally on the sides $BC, AC$ and $AB$ of the triangle. Then the lines $g(AP), g(BQ)$ and $g(CR)$ pass through a common point, the {\em Fermat point} of the triangle $\Delta\,ABC$.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
